intro: Helipterum heteranthum var. majus, commonly known as the showy helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
